content.description: Start on crimpy rail.  Move up and right for the top out.
content.location: Take a left 20 m before reaching the mount vernon overlook at a fallen oak.  Continue 30 m downhill to reach the top of the rock.  Downclimb to the landing.  Immediately to the right of Fancy Feast.

content.description: Climb up featured slab.  Trickier than it looks.
content.location: Large slab 20 ft. left of Apple Bloom.

content.description: Start on the left side of the wall, with an edge near the arete for the left hand and a pocket for the right.  Traverse right through the middle of the face through thin holds.  Gain the right arete and top out.  The underclings at your waist are not used.
content.location: The north side of the Mount Vernon Overlook.  In other words, cut left along the cliff line when you are walking up to the overlook and this will be one of the first walls you come to.

content.description: Climb the left arete of this boulder from a sit.  A nice undercling and a sloper topout await.  Duffy climbed some version of this problem a few years ago.
content.protection: 2 pads probably, one for the boulder behind you.
content.location: Left arete of the equestria boulder.  The sit start is below the start holds of princess celestia.

content.description: Start matched on a big triangle undercling and work straight up through the face. Topping out through a sloper finish reminiscent of a Fontainebleau finale. The arete to the right isn't used but wasn't tempting.
content.location: Equestria area. Climbs straight up through the middle of Princess Celestia.

content.description: Start slightly overhung on heavily featured rock.  Top out up and to the left.
content.location: take a left 20 m before reaching the mount vernon overlook at a fallen oak.  Continue 30 m downhill to reach the top of the rock.  Easy downclimb to a nice flat landing.

content.description: Tricky slab with tenuous feet. Start with large left side pull and right foot back stepped. Climb up the face trending right of the seam. The crux is stepping feet up in the middle. Could use some more cleaning but it goes.
content.protection: Flat landing. One pad and good to have a spotter so you don’t fall off the ledge to the right but a spotter is not essential.
content.location: Slab around the corner to the left of Princess Celestia

content.description: A solid little face off the northwest side of the overlook.  Visible from the trail when leaves are off.
